meanings.sent1: The spilled juice was maculating the clean tablecloth.
meanings.sent2: The muddy shoes were maculating the freshly mopped floor.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy was maculating the white carpet with its muddy paws.
meanings.sent4: His careless actions seemed to maculate the reputation of the entire team.
meanings.sent5: The graffiti artist's spray paint can maculate the pristine wall with colorful designs.

meanings.sent1: Leaving the metal exposed to the elements would maculate its surface over time.
meanings.sent2: The addition of artificial colors can maculate the purity of the natural ingredients.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally maculated the dish by adding too much salt.
meanings.sent4: The negative comments began to maculate her once flawless self-esteem.
meanings.sent5: The dishonesty in his words seemed to maculate the sincerity of his apology.
